original: @1b #// rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b #// rgya gar skad du /

original: mah'a ma y'u r'i bidya r'a dzny'i /
analyzed: mah'a ma y'u r'i bidya r'a dzny'i /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo //
translated: The Great Peacock Queen of Spells.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Śrāvakas, and Pratyekabuddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: @2a #// yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bdun po dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @2a #// yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bdun po dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the seven perfectly awakened ones together with their Saṅghas of Śrāvakas.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Arhats in the world.

original: byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal lo // phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Bodhisattvas, such as Maitreya.🔽Homage to the Non-returners.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to those who have correctly gone in the world.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to those who have correctly set out.

original: de dag la phyag 'tshal nas rig sngags @2b kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'di la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la phyag 'tshal nas rig sngags @2b kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'di la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Having paid homage to them, one should apply this queen of knowledge mantras, the Great Peacock Queen.

original: bdag la rig sngags de grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag la rig sngags de grub par gyur cig /
translated: May that knowledge mantra be accomplished for me.

original: 'byung po'i tshogs gang su dag sa la rgyu ba rnams dang / nam mkha' la rgyu ba rnams dang / chu la rgyu ba rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / rlung lha rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang /
analyzed: 'byung po'i tshogs gang su dag sa la rgyu ba rnams dang / nam mkha' la rgyu ba rnams dang / chu la rgyu ba rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / rlung lha rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang /
translated: Whatever hosts of bhūtas move on the earth, in the sky, in the water, the gods, nāgas, asuras, wind deities, garuḍas,

original: dri za rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / srin po rnams dang / yi dvags rnams dang / sha za rnams dang / 'byung po rnams dang / grul bum rnams dang / srul po rnams dang /🔽lus srul po rnams dang / skem byed rnams dang / smyo byed rnams dang / grib gnon rnams dang / brjed byed rnams dang / gnon po rnams bdag la nyon cig /🔽'byung po'i tshogs gzi byin 'phrog pa rnams dang / zas su mngal za ba rnams @3a *//
analyzed: dri za rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / srin po rnams dang / yi dvags rnams dang / sha za rnams dang / 'byung po rnams dang / grul bum rnams dang / srul po rnams dang / lus srul po rnams dang / skem byed rnams dang / smyo byed rnams dang / grib gnon rnams dang / brjed byed rnams dang / gnon po rnams bdag la nyon cig / 'byung po'i tshogs gzi byin 'phrog pa rnams dang / zas su mngal za ba rnams @3a *//
translated: gandharvas, kinnaras, mahoragas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, pretas, piśācas, bhūtas, pūtanas, kaṭapūtanas, unmadas, apasmāras, cchāyas, and ḍākinīs, listen to me!🔽All you hosts of bhūtas who steal splendor,🔽who eat wombs,

original: dang / zas su khrag 'thung pa rnams dang / zas su zhag za ba rnams dang / zas su sha za ba rnams dang / zas su tshil za ba rnams dang / zas su rkang za ba rnams dang / zas su btsas pa za ba rnams dang /
analyzed: dang / zas su khrag 'thung pa rnams dang / zas su zhag za ba rnams dang / zas su sha za ba rnams dang / zas su tshil za ba rnams dang / zas su rkang za ba rnams dang / zas su btsas pa za ba rnams dang /
translated: who drink blood, who eat fat, who eat flesh, who eat marrow, who eat semen, who eat feces, who eat urine, who eat phlegm, who eat bile, who eat pus, who eat mucus, who eat the dregs of liquor, who eat the dregs of spit, who eat the dregs of vomit, who eat the dregs of urine, who eat the dregs of feces, who eat the dregs of semen, who eat the dregs of menstrual blood, who eat the dregs of sweat, who eat the dregs of tears, who eat the dregs of snot, who eat the dregs of the body, who eat the dregs of the head, who eat the dregs of the hair, who eat the dregs of the nails, who eat the dregs of the teeth, who eat the dregs of the skin, who eat the dregs of the flesh, who eat the dregs of the blood, who eat the dregs of the bones, who eat the dregs of the marrow, who eat the dregs of the head, who eat the dregs of the hair, who eat the dregs of the nails, who eat the dregs of the teeth, who eat the dregs of the skin, who eat the dregs of the flesh, who eat the dregs of the blood, who eat the dregs of the bones, who eat the dregs of the marrow, who eat the dregs of the head, who eat the dregs of the hair, who eat the dregs of the nails, who eat the dregs of the teeth, who eat the dregs of the skin, who eat the dregs of the flesh, who eat the dregs of the blood, who eat the dregs of the bones, who eat the dregs of the marrow, who eat the dregs of the head, who eat the dregs of the hair, who eat the dregs of the nails, who eat the dregs of the teeth, who eat the dregs of the skin

original: srog 'phrog pa rnams dang / zas su gtor ma za ba rnams dang / zas su phreng ba za ba rnams dang / zas su dri za ba rnams dang / zas su bdug pa za ba rnams dang / zas su me tog za ba rnams dang /🔽zas su 'bras bu za ba rnams dang / zas su lo tog za ba rnams dang / zas su sbyin sreg za ba rnams dang / zas su rnag za ba rnams dang / zas su phyi sa za ba rnams dang / zas su gcin 'thung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: srog 'phrog pa rnams dang / zas su gtor ma za ba rnams dang / zas su phreng ba za ba rnams dang / zas su dri za ba rnams dang / zas su bdug pa za ba rnams dang / zas su me tog za ba rnams dang / zas su 'bras bu za ba rnams dang / zas su lo tog za ba rnams dang / zas su sbyin sreg za ba rnams dang / zas su rnag za ba rnams dang / zas su phyi sa za ba rnams dang / zas su gcin 'thung ba rnams dang /
translated: those who eat offerings, those who eat garlands, those who eat smells, those who eat incense, those who eat flowers,🔽those who eat fruit, those who eat crops, those who eat burnt offerings, those who eat pus, those who eat excrement, those who drink urine,

original: zas su lhag ma za ba rnams dang / zas su mchil ma za ba rnams dang / zas su ngar snabs za ba rnams dang / zas su snabs za ba rnams dang / zas @3b su mi gtsang ba za ba rnams dang / zas su skyug pa za ba rnams dang /
analyzed: zas su lhag ma za ba rnams dang / zas su mchil ma za ba rnams dang / zas su ngar snabs za ba rnams dang / zas su snabs za ba rnams dang / zas @3b su mi gtsang ba za ba rnams dang / zas su skyug pa za ba rnams dang /
translated: those who eat leftovers, those who eat spit, those who eat snot, those who eat mucus, those who eat filth, those who eat vomit,

original: zas su stor khung nas 'bab pa 'thung ba rnams dang / sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa rnams bdag la nyon cig /
analyzed: zas su stor khung nas 'bab pa 'thung ba rnams dang / sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa rnams bdag la nyon cig /
translated: Those who drink from the holes in the walls, those who have sinful minds, those who have hateful minds, those who have violent minds, and those who take the lives of others, listen to me!

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: This queen of incantations, the Great Peacock Queen, should be recited.

original: spos dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma yang sbyin no //
analyzed: spos dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma yang sbyin no //
translated: Incense, flowers, incense for burning, and sacrificial cakes should also be offered.

original: bdag la sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa rnams dang / zas su mdangs za ba'i gdon thams cad ni /
analyzed: bdag la sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa rnams dang / zas su mdangs za ba'i gdon thams cad ni /
translated: Those who have sinful minds, those who have hateful minds, those who have violent minds, those who take the lives of others, and all the spirits who feed on vitality,

original: dengs shig / zhi ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams ni /
analyzed: dengs shig / zhi ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams ni /
translated: all of you, disperse! Those who have peaceful minds, those who have loving minds, and those who have virtuous minds,

original: bdag la nyon cig /
analyzed: bdag la nyon cig /

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa rnams bdag la nyon cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa rnams bdag la nyon cig /
translated: Those who have faith in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, listen to me!

original: 'di lta ste /🔽nag mo bzhin sgyur ma /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nag mo bzhin sgyur ma /

original: grul bum ma /
analyzed: grul bum ma /

original: dung can ma /🔽me tog ka ma la lta bu'i mig can ma /
analyzed: dung can ma / me tog ka ma la lta bu'i mig can ma /

original: 'phrog ma; skra mdog ljang gu ma /
analyzed: 'phrog ma; skra mdog ljang gu ma /

original: dpal ldan ma /🔽spre'u ltar dmar ser ma /
analyzed: dpal ldan ma / spre'u ltar dmar ser ma /

original: 'phyang ma / rab tu 'phyang ma /
analyzed: 'phyang ma / rab tu 'phyang ma /

original: dus kyi zhags pa ma /
analyzed: dus kyi zhags pa ma /

original: bum lto ma /🔽gshin rje'i pho nya mo /
analyzed: bum lto ma / gshin rje'i pho nya mo /

original: gshin @4a *// rje'i sring mo /
analyzed: gshin @4a *// rje'i sring mo /

original: 'byung po za ba mo /
analyzed: 'byung po za ba mo /

original: me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / gtor ma 'di dbul gyi /
analyzed: me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / gtor ma 'di dbul gyi /
translated: I offer this flower, incense, perfume, and bali.

original: bzhes shig / 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa thams cad las bdag la srung du gsol /
analyzed: bzhes shig / 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa thams cad las bdag la srung du gsol /
translated: Please accept them and protect me from all dangers and harms.

original: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig /
analyzed: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig /
translated: May I live one hundred years.

original: ston brgya mthong bar shog cig /
analyzed: ston brgya mthong bar shog cig /
translated: May I see one hundred autumns.

original: bdag la rig sngags kyi tshig rnams grub par gyur cig sv'ah'a /
analyzed: bdag la rig sngags kyi tshig rnams grub par gyur cig sv'ah'a /
translated: May the words of the vidyā be accomplished for me. Svāhā!”

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
translated: the Bhagavān was dwelling in Śrāvastī,

original: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong sa ri zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong sa ri zhes bya ba /
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, there was a monk named Śaila.

original: gzhon nu thor bu lang tsho la bab pa rab tu byung nas ring po ma lon pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu thor bu lang tsho la bab pa rab tu byung nas ring po ma lon pa /
translated: He was a young man in the prime of youth, who had not long gone forth,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs nas ring po ma lon pa /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs nas ring po ma lon pa /
translated: had not long been fully ordained,

original: chos 'dul ba 'dir 'ongs nas ring po ma lon pa zhig gnas pa de dge 'dun gyi bsro gang bya ba'i phyir shing gshags pa dang / shing rul ba'i ser ka zhig nas sbrul nag po chen po zhig byung nas rkang pa g-yas pa'i mthe bong la zin pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'dir 'ongs nas ring po ma lon pa zhig gnas pa de dge 'dun gyi bsro gang bya ba'i phyir shing gshags pa dang / shing rul ba'i ser ka zhig nas sbrul nag po chen po zhig byung nas rkang pa g-yas pa'i mthe bong la zin pa dang /
translated: and had not long come to this Dharma and Vinaya. While he was staying there, he was chopping wood for the saṅgha’s sauna when a large black snake emerged from a crack in a rotten tree trunk, and bit his right toe.

original: lus sbrid nas sa la 'gyel te lbu bar skyug cing mig kyang gyur nas nyal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong sa ri nad kyis btab ste sdug bsngal zhing nad tshabs che @4b nas sa la 'gyel te /
analyzed: lus sbrid nas sa la 'gyel te lbu bar skyug cing mig kyang gyur nas nyal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong sa ri nad kyis btab ste sdug bsngal zhing nad tshabs che @4b nas sa la 'gyel te /
translated: The Venerable Ānanda saw that the monk Śāriputra was afflicted with illness, suffering, and great pain, and had fallen to the ground,

original: lbu bar skyug cing mig kyang gyur nas nyal zhing 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: lbu bar skyug cing mig kyang gyur nas nyal zhing 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: convulsed, foaming at the mouth, and rolling his eyes.

original: mthong nas kyang rings pa rings par bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo pos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang rings pa rings par bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo pos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having seen this, he quickly went to the Blessed One. Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

original: mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba 'di na dge slong sa ri zhes bgyi ba gzhon nu thor bu /
analyzed: mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba 'di na dge slong sa ri zhes bgyi ba gzhon nu thor bu /
translated: in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, there is a monk named Śāriputra, a young man,

original: lang tsho la bab pa /🔽rab tu byung nas ring po ma lags pa /
analyzed: lang tsho la bab pa / rab tu byung nas ring po ma lags pa /
translated: He was young,🔽had gone forth not long ago,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs nas ring po ma lags pa /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs nas ring po ma lags pa /
translated: had been fully ordained not long ago,

original: chos 'dul ba 'dir mchis nas ring por ma lags pa zhig gnas pa de dge 'dun gyi bsro gang bgyi ba'i slad du shing gshags pa dang / shing rul pa'i ser ka zhig nas sbrul nag po chen po zhig byung nas rkang pa g-yas pa'i mthe bong la zin pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'dir mchis nas ring por ma lags pa zhig gnas pa de dge 'dun gyi bsro gang bgyi ba'i slad du shing gshags pa dang / shing rul pa'i ser ka zhig nas sbrul nag po chen po zhig byung nas rkang pa g-yas pa'i mthe bong la zin pa dang /
translated: and had been in this Dharma and Vinaya not long. He was cutting wood for the saṅgha’s sauna when a large black snake came out from a crack in the rotten wood, bit him on the big toe of his right foot,

original: lus sbrid nas dog sa la 'gyel te /
analyzed: lus sbrid nas dog sa la 'gyel te /
translated: and his body went numb and he fell to the ground.

original: lbu bar skyug cing mig kyang gyur nas nyal zhing mchis na /
analyzed: lbu bar skyug cing mig kyang gyur nas nyal zhing mchis na /
translated: He vomited foam, his eyes rolled back, and he lay there.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

original: de la bdag gis ji ltar nan tan du bgyi /
analyzed: de la bdag gis ji ltar nan tan du bgyi /
translated: what should I do about him?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /🔽de bzhin @5a *//
analyzed: kun dga' bo /🔽de bzhin @5a *//

original: gshegs pa'i bkas khyod song la rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis lha'i gdon dang / klu'i gdon dang / lha ma yin gyi gdon dang / rlung lha'i gdon dang / nam mkha' lding gi gdon dang / dri za'i gdon dang / mi'am ci'i gdon dang /🔽lto 'phye chen po'i gdon dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon dang / srin po'i gdon dang / yi dvags kyi gdon dang / sha za'i gdon dang / 'byung po'i gdon dang / grul bum gyi gdon dang / srul po'i gdon dang / lus srul po'i gdon dang /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i bkas khyod song la rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis lha'i gdon dang / klu'i gdon dang / lha ma yin gyi gdon dang / rlung lha'i gdon dang / nam mkha' lding gi gdon dang / dri za'i gdon dang / mi'am ci'i gdon dang / lto 'phye chen po'i gdon dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon dang / srin po'i gdon dang / yi dvags kyi gdon dang / sha za'i gdon dang / 'byung po'i gdon dang / grul bum gyi gdon dang / srul po'i gdon dang / lus srul po'i gdon dang /
translated: By the Buddha's order, you should go and with this queen of incantations, the great Uṣṇīṣa Queen, remove the afflictions of the gods, nāgas, asuras, garuḍas, gandharvas, kinnaras,🔽mahoragas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, pretas, piśācas, bhūtas, kumbhāṇḍas, pūtanas, kaṭapūtanas,

original: skem byed kyi gdon dang / smyo byed kyi gdon dang / grib gnon gyi gdon dang / brjed byed kyi gdon dang / gnon po'i gdon dang / skar ma'i gdon dang / gshed byed dang / sgyur pa'i las dang / byad dang / g-yeng byed dang /
analyzed: skem byed kyi gdon dang / smyo byed kyi gdon dang / grib gnon gyi gdon dang / brjed byed kyi gdon dang / gnon po'i gdon dang / skar ma'i gdon dang / gshed byed dang / sgyur pa'i las dang / byad dang / g-yeng byed dang /
translated: ojohāras, unmādas, ābādhakas, apasmāras, grahas, nakṣatras, kaśmalas, and the actions of the rākṣasas, and the spells, sorcery, and distractions.

original: ro langs dang / sems sgyur ba dang / rbod gtong dang / bza' nyes dang / skyug nyes dang / gnod sgrib dang / gnod bltas dang / bri nyes dang / sgom nyes dang / smad pa dang / rims nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang /
analyzed: ro langs dang / sems sgyur ba dang / rbod gtong dang / bza' nyes dang / skyug nyes dang / gnod sgrib dang / gnod bltas dang / bri nyes dang / sgom nyes dang / smad pa dang / rims nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang /

original: rnam grol phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: de dag gis bdag la srung ba gyis shig /
analyzed: de dag gis bdag la srung ba gyis shig /

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa thams cad dang / rims thams cad dang / nad thams cad dang / gdon thams cad dang / dug thams cad las srung ba gyis shig /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa thams cad dang / rims thams cad dang / nad thams cad dang / gdon thams cad dang / dug thams cad las srung ba gyis shig /
translated: May they protect me from all fears, all harms, all epidemics, all disturbances, all fevers, all illnesses, all spirits, and all poisons.

original: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig /
analyzed: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig /

original: ston brgya mthong bar shog cig /

analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa /

analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye rgu dang bcas pa / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten na ma mthong ngo //

original: lha ni / lha 'du ba'i gnas su ma yin /
analyzed: lha ni / lha 'du ba'i gnas su ma yin /

analyzed: rlung lha 'du ba'i gnas su ma yin / nam mkha' lding ni /

analyzed: nam mkha' lding 'du ba'i gnas su ma yin / dri za ni /

translated: the fear of armies of enemies, the fear of famine, the fear of untimely death, the fear of earthquakes, the fear of the king of the land, the fear of ferocious beasts, the fear of unfriendliness,🔽

original: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las bdag la srung ba gyis shig /🔽shu ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / 'brum bu phra mo dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa dang / me dbal dang / lhog pa'i 'jigs pa las srung ba gyis shig /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las bdag la srung ba gyis shig / shu ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / 'brum bu phra mo dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa dang / me dbal dang / lhog pa'i 'jigs pa las srung ba gyis shig /
translated: protect me from the fear of armies of enemies, the fear of famine, the fear of untimely death, the fear of earthquakes, the fear of the king, the fear of ferocious beasts, the fear of unwholesome company,🔽and the fear of death.🔽Protect me from the fear of leprosy, scabies, psoriasis, smallpox, anal fistula, boils, eczema, erysipelas, and epilepsy.

original: @25a *// klad pa na ba dang / gzhogs phyed na ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / mig nad dang / sna nad dang / kha nad dang / mgul nad dang / snying nad dang / lkog ma'i lha gor na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang /

translated: Protect me from the fear of headaches, hemiplegia, loss of appetite, eye diseases, nose diseases, mouth diseases, throat diseases, heart diseases, goiter, ear diseases,

original: so na ba dang / snying na ba dang / rtsi ba logs na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / mkhur ba na ba dang / chu so na ba dang / skye gnas na ba dang / rab tu skye gnas na ba dang /

translated: Make them free of pain in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽Make them free of pain in the head, the brain, the mouth, the throat, the heart, the lungs, the liver, the spleen, the kidneys, the stomach, the small and large intestines, the joints, the bones, the muscles, the channels, the flesh, the skin, the hands, the feet, the limbs, and the appendages.

translated: He has destroyed all one-day fevers, all two-day fevers, all three-day fevers, all four-day fevers, all seven-day fevers, all half-month fevers, all month-long fevers, all day fevers,

original: mtshan mo pa rnams dang / yud tsam pa rnams dang / rtag pa'i rims rnams dang / rims drag po rnams dang / rlung las gyur pa rnams dang / mkhris @32b pa las gyur pa rnams dang / bad kan las gyur pa rnams dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa rnams dang /

translated: all night fevers, all momentary fevers, all constant fevers, all severe fevers, all wind-related fevers, all bile-related fevers, all phlegm-related fevers, and all complex fevers.

original: mi'i rims rnams dang / mi ma yin pa'i rims rnams bcom mo //
analyzed: mi'i rims rnams dang / mi ma yin pa'i rims rnams bcom mo //

original: rims thams cad bcom mo //
analyzed: rims thams cad bcom mo //

analyzed: gdon thams cad dang / dug thams cad dang / nad thams cad bcom mo //
translated: I have destroyed all demons, all poisons, and all diseases.

analyzed: bdag bde legs su gyur cig / mtshan mo bde legs nyin bde legs //

analyzed: nyin ma'i gung gi bde legs dang // nyin mtshan kun gyi bde legs dag /

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis bdag la stsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis bdag la stsol //

original: sangs rgyas phyag 'tshal byang chub 'tshal lo //

original: grol @33a *// gyur phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: zhi gyur phyag 'tshal zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the peaceful one, I pay homage to the one who is at peace.

original: rnam grol phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: mngal bde legs su gyur cig /

original: zhi gyur phyag 'tshal zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: zhi gyur phyag 'tshal zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: rnam grol phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rnam grol phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is liberated, I pay homage to the one who is free.

original: bram ze gang dag sdig pa'i chos rnams bsal bar gyur pa de dag la yang phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bram ze gang dag sdig pa'i chos rnams bsal bar gyur pa de dag la yang phyag 'tshal lo //
